result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Amended Guilty Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Ayanna C McAfee in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Ayanna C McAfee.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO THE AMENDED COUNTS 1 and 2: 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to defendant's plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she and may not possess any firearms. 

Case is adjourned to 12-8-22 at 2:00 pm for sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Ayanna C McAfee
Current: 621 East Decorah Road, #208, West Bend, WI 53095   (Effective: 10-17-2022)
Prior: 621 E. Decorah Road, #208, West Bend, WI 53095
and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, filed.
Defense Jury Instructions, filed.
Defense Jury Instructions, filed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Ayanna C McAfee appeared by video.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Ayanna C McAfee.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 10-17-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.
filed.
State's Motion In Limine, filed.
Defense Motion In Limine, filed.
Defense Motion In Limine, filed.
filed.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. EXPIRES: 10/17/2022

Defendant Ayanna C McAfee in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Ayanna C McAfee in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ayanna C McAfee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defense's Bail/Bond Hearing held.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies defense's bail motion.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY trial demand.  Court held colloquy with defendant regarding expiration of speedy trial demand.  Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives her right to a speedy trial within 90 days.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Ayanna C McAfee not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  However, case was incorrectly tabbed to Branch 40.  This case is assigned to Branch 10, Judge Havas. Defense requests a bail/bond hearing to be heard in Branch 10.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion from defendant, Reduce Bail

Defendant Ayanna C McAfee in court with Attorney Fred Richardson; both appear by video.  Defendant Ayanna C McAfee in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Martinez. Court took judicial notice of Washington County case 21CF523. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ayanna C McAfee in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Ayanna C McAfee in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ayanna C McAfee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 4 and 5. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Leren J.B.; NJT (6/2/10); JAT (4/3/09)
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
